column4: if I want to have a full X desktop from a remote linux machine on my windows laptop would I have to use something like vnc?
I can't run a local X server on the windows machine and get a full desktop right?
There is an X server on Windows
You can use it to forward X11 through ssh
does it provide a full desktop though or so I just open windows by running commands on commandline?
it's not like remote desktop though; you can't use it to control programs already running
yeah I'm looking for something that I can get going menu driven
X11 forwarding basically allows you to run the application on the Linux machine, but the X11 bits get forwarded to the X11 server on the Windows machine
I couldn't use that to create a gnome desktop locally I suppose?
if you want to do something like logging into GNOME from on the Windows machine, there's XDMCP
I'm pretty sure that GDM no longer supports XDMCP though
yeah it doesn't look like anything is listening on port 177
I recommend checking out FreeNX, it's a lot better than VNC
a lot better meaning that it's faster and more secure
